{{sld|Avengers & X-Men: AXIS Vol 1 6}}(Formal creation) | HistoryText = {{Quote|[[Avengers & X-Men: AXIS|Right now]], the world doesn't need '''heroes.''' It needs '''villains.'''|[[Max Eisenhardt (Earth-616)|Magneto]]|Magneto Vol 3 11}} In the wake of the [[Avengers & X-Men: AXIS|World War Hate]], the [[Johann Shmidt (Clone) (Earth-616)|Red Onslaught]] released his [[Stark Sentinels]], robots designed specifically as counter measures against super heroes, due to their date being based on Tony Stark's files during the Civil War.{{r|Avengers & X-Men: AXIS Vol 1 1}} Magneto recruited numerous super villains to join forces against the common threat the Red Skull represented,{{r|Avengers & X-Men: AXIS Vol 1 2}} and managed to turn the tide of the battle for enough time so the Scarlet Witch and Doctor Doom could cast a spell to invert the Red Onslaught's personality and defeat him.{{r|Avengers & X-Men: AXIS Vol 1 3}} However, the spell affected all of those present in the battle, including Magneto's group. Thus, the heroes became evil, and the villains of Magneto's group became good.{{r|Avengers & X-Men: AXIS Vol 1 4}} After the Red Onslaught was defeated, the villains from the group went separate ways.{{r|Avengers & X-Men: AXIS Vol 1 3}} After it was noticeable something was wrong with some of the Avengers and the X-Men, [[Steven Rogers (Earth-616)|Steve Rogers]] reassembled the inverted villains so they could form the resistance against the inverted heroes.{{r|Avengers & X-Men: AXIS Vol 1 6}} Even though the Astonishing Avengers failed to stop the inverted X-Men,{{r|Avengers & X-Men: AXIS Vol 1 7}} the appearance of the [[Axis (Avengers) (Earth-616)|Axis]] gave them a second wind to keep on fighting{{r|Avengers & X-Men: AXIS Vol 1 8}} long enough for Doctor Doom, the White Skull (the inverted version of the Red Skull), and the Scarlet Witch (possessed by [[Daniel Drumm (Earth-616)|Daniel Drumm]] in order to cooperate) to cast a reinversion spell, which turned almost everyone back to normal. Before the battle, the Astonishing Avengers had decided to record a video sent to the media, in which they blamed the evil actions of the Avengers and the X-Men on themselves, claiming to have manipulated the heroes using the [[Amora (Earth-616)|Enchantress]]' magic, as the "Axis of Evil."{{r|Avengers & X-Men: AXIS Vol 1 9}} | Equipment = | Transportation = | Weapons = | Notes = | Trivia = | Links = }} [[Category:Max Eisenhardt (Earth-616)/Quotes]]
